Package adris.altoclef.trackers

Class BlockTracker

java.lang.Object
adris.altoclef.trackers.Tracker
adris.altoclef.trackers.BlockTracker
public class BlockTracker extends Tracker
Tracks blocks the way we want it, when we want it. Gives you a "Check and don't care" interface where you can check for blocks and their locations over and over again without scanning the world over and over again. Also keeps track of blacklists for unreachable blocks

    • isTracking

      public boolean isTracking​(net.minecraft.block.Block block)

    • trackBlock

      public void trackBlock​(net.minecraft.block.Block... blocks)
      Starts tracking/pay attention to some blocks. IMPORTANT: ALWAYS pair with stopTracking! Otherwise this block type will be tracked forever (not the end of the world, but other block types will be lost.

    • stopTracking

      public void stopTracking​(net.minecraft.block.Block... blocks)
      Stops tracking some blocks, after calling trackBlock. Only call this once for every trackBlock.

      public boolean anyFound​(Predicate<net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos> isValidTest, net.minecraft.block.Block... blocks)
      Checks whether any blocks of a type have been found.
      Parameters:
      isValidTest - A filter predicate, returns true if a block at a position should be included.
      blocks - The blocks to check for

    • getNearestTracking

      public Optional<net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos> getNearestTracking​(net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d pos, Predicate<net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos> isValidTest, net.minecraft.block.Block... blocks)
      Gets the nearest tracked block.
      Parameters:
      pos - From what position? (defaults to the player's position)
      isValidTest - Filter predicate
      blocks - The blocks to check for
      Returns:
      Optional.of(block position) if found, otherwise Optional.empty

      Parameters:
      pos - The center of this radius

    • requestBlockUnreachable

      public void requestBlockUnreachable​(net.minecraft.util.math.BlockPos pos, int allowedFailures)
      Inform the block tracker that the bot was NOT able to reach a block.
      Parameters:
      pos - block that we were unable to reach
      allowedFailures - how many times we can try reaching before we finally declare this block "unreachable"
